importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Dr Hussam Abu Safia was arrested by Israeli forces on this date after a raid on Kamal Adwan Hospital, one of the last functioning medical facilities in North Gaza.
As of this date, Healthcare Workers Watch (HWW) has documented 431 cases of detained Palestinian healthcare workers between October 7, 2023, and October 20, 2025.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: This period marks the timeframe during which Healthcare Workers Watch documented 431 cases of Palestinian healthcare workers being detained by Israeli authorities, highlighting a sustained pattern of detention and abuse.

keyTakeAways: At least 95 Palestinian healthcare workers are currently held captive by Israeli authorities, with 80 from Gaza and 15 from the West Bank.
Most healthcare workers were abducted from hospitals or ambulances while on duty, and many have suffered torture, physical abuse, denial of medical care, and inadequate hygiene.
Dr Hussam Abu Safia, director of Kamal Adwan Hospital in North Gaza, was arrested on December 27, 2024, and held without charge or trial under the Unlawful Combatants Law.
Since his arrest, credible reports indicate he has endured significant weight loss, torture, and denial of legal representation and medical care.
At least 94% of hospitals in Gaza have been damaged or destroyed, and over 1,722 healthcare workers have been killed in Israeli strikes over two years.
As of October 20, 2025, 22 detained healthcare workers' families have not received updates, and 5 more are missing, with no known whereabouts.
The average detention period for those still held is 511 days, with some detained since the early weeks of the war.
The detained workers include 31 nurses, 17 physicians, 15 hospital support staff, 14 paramedics, two pharmacists, and one medical technician.
Most detainees are male, with 25 holding senior positions, 50 mid-level, and five junior roles; 36 are from North Gaza, 24 from Khan Younis, 18 from Gaza City, and 3 from Rafah.

A protest by healthcare workers and doctors in London, organized by Healthcare Workers Watch and Amnesty International UK, called for the immediate and unconditional release of all detained medical personnel.

namedEntities.name: Unlawful Combatants Law

summaryOfNewsArticle: The article details the ongoing detention of at least 95 Palestinian healthcare workers by Israeli authorities, with 80 from Gaza and 15 from the West Bank. Most were abducted from hospitals or ambulances while on duty, and many have faced torture, abuse, and denial of medical care. Dr Hussam Abu Safia, director of Kamal Adwan Hospital in North Gaza, is a central figure, having been arrested on December 27, 2024, and held without charge under the controversial Unlawful Combatants Law. Over 1,720 healthcare workers have been killed in Israeli strikes in the past two years, and hospitals have been extensively damaged. As of October 20, 2025, 22 families have not received updates, and five detainees are missing. A protest in London by healthcare workers, co-organized by Healthcare Workers Watch and Amnesty International UK, demands the immediate and unconditional release of all detained medics. The situation is seen as a serious violation of international humanitarian law, with healthcare workers targeted for their professional roles, exacerbating a already devastated health system in Gaza.
